answers.answer: I would try not to worry. I measured almost 3 weeks ahead for most of my pregnancy, but near the end I was right on target.
Thanks Victoria! I am a little bit nervous.

If your Dr. isn't worried, I wouldn't worry either.  As the gal above said, they can do that at times.  My boys were always a bit ahead too, may have ovulated soon, or baby hit a spurt.  When you get closer to the end they will watch a little closer on the size, but they can always be off.  Congrats!

question: I had an ultrasound yesterday and my baby measured about 10 days ahead of its gestational age..I am 16.2 weeks and the baby was 17.6 weeks .. should i worry?I havent gained any weight, so i dont think its gestational diabetes..
title: is baby too large?
